title: India and France Collaborate on TRISHNA Satellite Project
description:
India and France have agreed to jointly develop the TRISHNA (Thermal infraRed Imaging Satellite for High-resolution Natural resource Assessment) mission. Key aspects include:

  • Monitoring Earth's surface temperature and water stress.
  • Launch scheduled for 2026 aboard a PSLV rocket.
  • Enhancing bilateral space cooperation.

title: France in Talks to Procure India's Pinaka Rocket Launcher System
description:
France is in advanced discussions with India to acquire the Pinaka multi-barrel rocket launcher system. Highlights:

  • Potential first-time arms purchase by France from India.
  • Pinaka system has a range of up to 90 km.
  • Demonstrated to French officials with satisfactory results.

title: India-France Agreement on Gaganyaan Mission Cooperation
description:
India and France have signed an agreement to collaborate on India's Gaganyaan human spaceflight mission. Key points:

  • Training of Indian flight physicians and mission control teams in France.
  • Use of French equipment and medical instruments by Indian astronauts.
  • Support for scientific experiments on validation missions.

title: India and France Extend Megha-Tropiques Climate Monitoring Mission
description:
India and France have agreed to extend their joint Megha-Tropiques satellite mission for climate monitoring. Key details:

  • Mission provides 3D mapping of atmospheric water states.
  • Enhances forecasting of cyclones, monsoons, and droughts.
  • Extension signed during bilateral talks in Paris.

title: India-France Strategic Dialogue on Space Issues Established
description:
India and France have initiated a bilateral strategic dialogue on space issues to enhance cooperation. Highlights:

  • Focus on maintaining secure access to space for all.
  • Discussion on norms and principles applicable to space.
  • Exploration of new areas of cooperation in space sector.
